lead_paragraph: Mr. Trump may have uttered words about unfair trade deals or threats to national security, but what some voters heard instead was his voice on that searing recording.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Yamiche Alcindor, Sarah Maslin Nir, Sara Olkon and Rebecca Raney.
byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and AMY CHOZICK

headline.print_headline: For Some Women, Words on Bus Echo Louder Than Talk Onstage
headline.main: Donald Trump Talks at Debate, but Many Women Hear Only a 2005 Tape

snippet: Mr. Trump may have uttered words about unfair trade deals or threats to national security, but what some voters heard instead was his voice on that searing recording....
abstract: News Analysis; women interviewed across country following second debate between Hillary Clinton and Donald J Trump range in their opinions over sexually predatory comments made by Trump revealed in 2005 recording; some express being so upset their anger overshadowed their ability to hear any meaningful policy discussions coming out of town hall event, while others say raunchy tape is decade-old distraction with no relevance to presidency.
